td.p: • Lifetime diagnosis of psychosis, bipolar disorder, anorexia, autism, or Tourette disorder
• Current chronic tic disorder, substance-use disorder, binge-eating disorder, bulimia, or suicidality
• Current use of psychotropic medications or CBT for OCD
• Current or lifetime psychiatric disorder other than MDD or anxiety disorders
• Current or lifetime psychiatric disorder other than MDD or anxiety disorders (if not in past year)
• Current or past use of psychotropic medications
• First-degree relative with OCD or tic disorder

table-wrap-foot.p: OCD Obsessive-compulsive disorder, YBOCS Yale-Brown Obsessive-Compulsive Severity Scale, CBT Cognitive-behavioral therapy, IQ Intelligence quotient, MRI Magnetic resonance imaging, MDD Major depressive disorder

extracted-table.transformed-table:
Table 1
Inclusion and Exclusion Criteria
OCD (n = 250)Unaffected Siblings (n = 100)Healthy Controls (n = 250)
Inclusion Criteria• 18–50 years old• Principal diagnosis of OCD• YBOCS ≥16• 18–50 years old• Has sibling with OCD• 18–50 years old
Exclusion Criteria• Lifetime diagnosis of psychosis, bipolar disorder, anorexia, autism, or Tourette disorder• Current chronic tic disorder, substance-use disorder, binge-eating disorder, bulimia, or suicidality• Current use of psychotropic medications or CBT for OCD• Current or lifetime psychiatric disorder other than MDD or anxiety disorders• Current use of psychotropic medications• Current or lifetime psychiatric disorder other than MDD or anxiety disorders (if not in past year)• Current or past use of psychotropic medications• First-degree relative with OCD or tic disorder
• Major medical or neurological diseases • IQ < 80 • Contraindications to MRIOCD Obsessive-compulsive disorder, YBOCS Yale-Brown Obsessive-Compulsive Severity Scale, CBT Cognitive-behavioral therapy, IQ Intelligence quotient, MRI Magnetic resonance imaging, MDD Major depressive disorder

tr.td: University of São Paulo Sensory Phenomena Scale (USP-SPS) [102]
Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-5 (SCID) [103]; Center for OCD and Related Disorders Age of Onset and Course Form

Autism Spectrum Quotienta [106]; Center for OCD and Related Disorders Tic Questionnaire; Disgust Propensity and Sensitivity Scalea [107]; Impulsive-Compulsive Behaviours Checklista [108]; Obsessive-Compulsive Personality Disorder Questionnaire
World Health Organization Disability Assessment Schedule 2.0 (WHODAS) [109]

table-wrap-foot.p: aSelf-report measure; all other measures are administered by a trained clinician

tr.td: Percent of correct trials overall and per condition
Percent of correct trials overall and per task load
Discount rate parameter on the intertemporal choice task [and risk aversion parameter on the risk aversion task]
Mean reaction time and Stroop effect
Learning rate, speed and accuracy, variability in motor performance
Proportion of decisions to repeat a rewarded choice vs. an unrewarded choice following either a common or rare transition

tr.td: 3D sagittal T1-weighted MP-RAGE according to ADNI-3 protocol (1 × 1 × 1 mm resolution)
T2*-weighted echo-planar images while subjects are awake and keep their eyes closed (10 min, TR = 2200 ms, TE = 28 ms, 3.3 × 3.3 mm in-plane resolution, 3 mm slices with 0.3 mm gap)
multi-shell single spin echo DWI (80 interleaved volumes: 7 b0, 25 b1000, 24 b2000, 24 b3000, 2.5 × 2.5 × 2.5 mm)
T1-weighted image with improved SNR and gray-white matter contrast (1 × 1 × 1 mm resolution)

table-wrap-foot.p: All sites use a 32-channel head coil, except NYC which uses a 48-channel head coil. Abbreviations: rs-fMRI Resting-state functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging, DWI Diffusion weighted Imaging, PSIR Phase sensitive inversion recovery

MRI Sequences
Structural T13D sagittal T1-weighted MP-RAGE according to ADNI-3 protocol (1 × 1 × 1 mm resolution)
rs-fMRIT2*-weighted echo-planar images while subjects are awake and keep their eyes closed (10 min, TR = 2200 ms, TE = 28 ms, 3.3 × 3.3 mm in-plane resolution, 3 mm slices with 0.3 mm gap)
DWImulti-shell single spin echo DWI (80 interleaved volumes: 7 b0, 25 b1000, 24 b2000, 24 b3000, 2.5 × 2.5 × 2.5 mm)
PSIRT1-weighted image with improved SNR and gray-white matter contrast (1 × 1 × 1 mm resolution)All sites use a 32-channel head coil, except NYC which uses a 48-channel head coil. Abbreviations: rs-fMRI Resting-state functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging, DWI Diffusion weighted Imaging, PSIR Phase sensitive inversion recovery
